solution_line_template: Through March, Dr. Banks gave out {january_giveaway} + {february_giveaway} + {march_giveaway} = <<{january_giveaway}+{february_giveaway}+{march_giveaway}={total_given_through_march}>>{total_given_through_march} toothbrushes.

Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had {initial_toothbrushes} -{total_given_through_march} = <<{initial_toothbrushes}-{total_given_through_march}={remaining_before_april}>>{remaining_before_april} toothbrushes remaining.

Between April and May, he gave out the remaining {remaining_before_april} / {months_remaining_division} = <<{remaining_before_april}/{months_remaining_division}={giveaway_per_month_april_may}>>{giveaway_per_month_april_may} toothbrushes each month.

The difference would be {giveaway_per_month_april_may}- {march_giveaway} = <<{giveaway_per_month_april_may}-{march_giveaway}={difference_busiest_slowest}>>{difference_busiest_slowest} more toothbrushes in the busiest month.
